result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tracy Donna Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tracy Donna Hamilton appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Tracy Donna Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding her right to have an in-person hearing. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Review hearing scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Tracy Donna Hamilton appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Tracy Donna Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Signed. Order appointing attorney at county expense.

Defendant Tracy Donna Hamilton appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Golden, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference to Br 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Tracy Donna Hamilton in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for an indigency hearing in Branch 29.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ER. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Tracy Donna Hamilton in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 1:30p
